comment.author: 38016434@N05
comment._content: I am not 100% sure, but it looks very like the "People Gardens" in the Phoenix Park, Dublin My image taken in May 2010, looks like it could have been taken from the same spot... www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05/4974687379/

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05] Thanks a million! I think you could be right about the Phoenix Park because of the hilly nature of the area too! It's the building on the horizon that's ringing Phoenix Park bells for me though...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: Can't place the building in the background, but if it was the People's Gardens, then if would have been taken somewhere near here.

comment.author: 53227388@N00
comment._content: This looks to be the building in the background. It's obscured by trees in the modern day street view above.

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: I think ye have it lads. Aerial view and pics of the different types of railings, topography and background buildings all add up. Well spotted [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05]

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The second I saw it I thought Dublin Zoo but then I saw [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05] comment and realised that I had seen that scene when entering the Zoo as a child and always remembered it as part of the Zoo.  Interesting that the urchins stand still while the gentleman has moved?  That building in the background is the Army HQ/Dept. of Defence building.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/woesinger] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Thanks a million to all of you! And [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] you didn't miss out on this one!

You all set a new Flickr land speed record in identifying this Fergus O'Connor photo - only around 80 more in that collection to go...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] And the Irish Army Headquarters you id-ed started out life as the Royal Military Infirmary designed in the main by James Gandon.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 38016434@N05
comment._content: On a side note ....  Watched TV3 AM this morning and saw Carol praising the photogrpahers who help with identifying images on the NLI site here., She mentioned this particular image as an example.  I appreciated her comments

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38016434@N05] Good of you to say, but this photostream would be nothing without all of you!
